examples.sentence: This YA novel about wuxia vampires sold 1 million copies.
YA readers obsessed with cyberpunk xianxia crossover stories.
The drone's YA stability is crucial for aerial photography.
Pilots adjust YA control when flying through typhoons.
Her YA fiction featuring AI Taoist priests became a trend.
The police yacht chased the smuggler's boat at 60 knots.
His new carbon fiber yacht looks like a spaceship on water.
The billionaire's yacht has a helicopter pad and cinema.
We watched fireworks from the yacht during Macau's regatta.
Jack Ma yachts around Malta during summer vacations.
Learning to yacht is mandatory in some European boarding schools.
They yachted along the Adriatic coast eating fresh oysters.
During the Cannes Festival, stars yacht between parties.
The Sanya yacht club hosts the annual Hainan sailing competition.
Let's go yachting during Golden Week to avoid tourist crowds.

examples.sentence: Weekend yachting in Sanya is the new status symbol for tech elites.
He ruined his designer sunglasses while yachting in a sudden storm.
The America's Cup is the Wimbledon of competitive yachting.
Olympic yachting events were nearly canceled due to lack of wind.

Her Instagram is full of yachting photos with champagne.
Coast guard officers train in high-speed yachting techniques.
The smuggler was caught yachting with 200kg of durians.
Let's go yachting instead of staying in the office on Friday!
The initiation fee for that yachting club could buy a Tesla.

examples.sentence: The yachtsman navigated through the storm like a veteran sea wolf.
As a licensed yachtsman, he can operate vessels up to 24 meters.
Billionaire yachtsmen often customize their boats with helipads.
The yachtsman hosted a champagne party on his 50-meter floating palace.
Professional yachtsmen need to master celestial navigation.

"Yah! Who put durian in the office microwave?!"

examples.sentence: The yak caravan carried Pu'er tea across Himalayan trails.
Yak butter tea is the ultimate anti-cold beverage in Tibet.
His 3-hour meeting was pure corporate yak.
We filtered out the marketing yaks in the report.
Aunties yak nonstop while dancing in the square.
Taxi drivers yak about football throughout the ride.
The comedians made audiences yak with Sichuan dialect jokes.
Girls yaked over their childhood photos in the group chat.
Retired uncles yak it up over mahjong tables.
Yak hair scarves are warmer than cashmere.
The purple yam mooncakes became viral on Xiaohongshu last Mid-Autumn Festival.
Grandma's yam congee always cures my winter colds.
The herbal medicine contains powdered Chinese yam.
Farmers harvest wild yams in the mountains every autumn.
Professor Yang Zhenning won the Nobel Prize in Physics.
Yang's Braised Chicken is a famous dish in Shandong province.
He yanked the tablecloth without dropping any dishes â€“ just like a magician!
The toddler kept yanking the dog's tail until the poor pup hid under the sofa.
The dentist yanked out my wisdom tooth with a terrifying 'pop' sound.
The monkey yanked away my ice cream cone in Shanghai Zoo.

examples.sentence: The Pomeranian kept yapping at the delivery robot.
Neighbors complained about the yapping Chihuahuas at 3am.

Ignore those influencers yapping nonsense on TikTok.

The coach yapped at the players during timeout.
The sudden yap from the alley startled me.
A series of high-pitched yaps came from the pet carrier.
Don't listen to his political yap during hotpot time.
Her 1000-word essay was pure yap with no substance.
The old yap next door complains about everything.
Nobody likes working with that office yap.
She yapped away during the entire movie.
The Karen yapped at the cashier for no reason.
The Forbidden City's walls extend over 3,000 yards.
This silk costs 88 yuan per yard at Yiwu Market.
Beijing siheyuan yards often have pomegranate trees.
We're hosting a hot pot party in the backyard this weekend.
The shipyard in Qingdao builds aircraft carriers.
Railway yards look like giant model train sets at night.
Her front yard has a lantern display during Mid-Autumn Festival.
The school yard echoes with jump rope rhymes at recess.
The cowboy paid extra for 24-hour yardage at the railway station.
Disputes over yardage often occurred in 19th-century cattle towns.
Modern yardage is calculated by the weight of livestock.
The sheep trader negotiated yardage like bargaining for mutton hotpot.

examples.sentence: The tailor measured the fabric with a wooden yardstick.
She keeps her grandfather's brass yardstick as a family heirloom.
GDP growth is no longer the only yardstick for national development.
In tech companies, user engagement is a key yardstick.
Honesty should be the yardstick in all business dealings.
For teachers, fairness is the fundamental yardstick.
We shouldn't measure kindergarteners and PhD students by the same yardstick.
Likes shouldn't be your yardstick of success on social media.
This alpaca yarn is softer than your ex's promises.
Grandma knits sweaters with rainbow yarn for stray cats.
Uncle Li's fishing yarns grow bigger each time, now he claims to have caught a mermaid.
Don't spin me your yarn about 'the dog ate my homework' again!
He spun such a wild yarn that even his goldfish looked skeptical.
When she yarns over incorrectly, her scarf ends up looking like abstract art.

examples.sentence: The fortune-teller scattered yarrow stalks to predict my love life.
Yarrow growing by the roadside reminded her of childhood herb-collecting trips.
Grandma brews yarrow tea with honey when I have a cold.
The fishing boat began to yaw violently in the storm.
Drunk tourists yawed along the deck like penguins.
The captain cursed as the ship yawed 20 degrees off course.
Autopilot automatically corrects when the plane yaws.
The 5-degree yaw caused our cruise ship to miss the port.
SpaceX rockets adjust for yaw during re-entry.
The panda's cute yaw attracted millions of live-stream viewers.
Her subtle yaw indicated disagreement during the meeting.
The drone's yaw angle exceeded safety limits.
F1 drivers monitor yaw rate to prevent spins.
The panda's contagious yawn made all tourists follow suit.
Her yawn during the meeting was as wide as the Yangtze River.
Students yawned like synchronized swimmers during the physics class.
The Great Wall yawns across mountains like a stone dragon.
The earthquake made the ground yawn suddenly.
His worn-out shoes yawned at the toes embarrassingly.
'Another meeting tomorrow...' he yawned desperately.
The tour guide yawned the historical facts like a broken recorder.
The audience yawned their heads off during the three-hour opera.
There's a yawning gap between my salary and housing prices.

examples.sentence: "Did you eat my fried chicken?" "Yeah... with chili sauce!"
When the teacher asked if anyone liked homework, only one voice said "Yeah" weakly.
"Wanna grab bubble tea?" "Yeah, but make it less sugar this time!"
The excited puppy's tail wagged like a windshield wiper when I asked "Yeah? Want a treat?"
"Oh yeah! I forgot to pick up my mooncake order!"
"I finished the report last night." "Yeah right, I saw you playing Honor of Kings!"
The WeChat annual report revealed I spent 2 years' worth of time scrolling moments.
Chinese zodiac has 12 animal signs representing each year.
This year's hottest new year gift was ChatGPT subscription cards.
The Year of Dragon always sees a baby boom in China.
When asked about her year, the actress said 'Just like fine wine'.
Panda years count differently - 1 human year equals 3 panda years.
My mom makes zongzi year after year for Dragon Boat Festival.
Hainan coconut sellers work all year round thanks to the tropical climate.

examples.sentence: The panda yearling clumsily rolled down the hill like a fuzzy black-and-white ball.
Kentucky Derby only allows yearling horses to participate.
The yearly AI conference gathers tech giants in Shenzhen.
Her yearly bonus equals three months' salary.
The yearly Lantern Festival parade features giant pandas.
We prepare special mooncakes for our yearly family reunion.
The app updates yearly with zodiac animal themes.
He travels to Tibet yearly like clockwork.
The Great Wall Marathon is held yearly in May.
We audit the accounts yearly before Spring Festival.
Douyin influencers are paid on a yearly basis.
Freshmen yearn for the canteen's braised pork after military training.
Her eyes yearned like a cat staring at a fish tank.
Overseas students yearn for their mom's dumplings during Spring Festival.
The old photo made him yearn for his childhood in the hutong.
Grandparents yearn for the days when neighborhoods played mahjong together.
This Peking opera song yearns for the golden age of traditional art.
Her heart yearned for the stray dogs in winter.
We yearn for those affected by the earthquake while donating supplies.
Tired commuters yearn for a seat on Beijing Subway Line 10.
His thoughts yearn towards his hometown when autumn comes.

examples.sentence: The yearning for hot pot drove her to queue for 3 hours.
His eyes held the yearning of a stray cat eyeing grilled fish.
The mooncake rekindled her yearning for hometown.
Old photos always bring a yearning for childhood.
His yearning look at the last baozi made me give up my share.
The puppy's yearning whimpers convinced me to buy extra treats.
Her yearning for bubble tea exceeded her monthly budget.
The secret of my grandma's mantou is using rice wine yeast.
Yeast turns sugar into bubbles that make beer fizzy.
Eating too much sugar may cause yeast infection.
Tourists yell when seeing pandas rolling in the snow.
Don't yell at the delivery guy even if your spicy hotpot is late.
Crowds yell in unison when the national team scores.
Little girls yell with excitement at Bubble Tea Festival.
He yelled 'Check please!' across the hotpot restaurant.
The coach yelled instructions during the basketball game.
A sudden yell came from the haunted house attraction.
The yell of street vendors selling stinky tofu is iconic.
Someone yelled out 'Free dumplings!' in the canteen.
Never yell at the AI speaker when it misunderstands you.
The yellow of sunflowers always reminds me of summer.
In China, yellow was traditionally reserved for the emperor.
She wore a yellow cheongsam for the Spring Festival photo.
The yellow warning sign says 'Caution: Wet Floor'.
My grandma still looks up plumbers in the yellow pages.
The traveler got vaccinated against yellow fever.
The ancient book pages had yellowed over centuries like autumn leaves.
Grandma's wedding photo was yellowed at the edges but still precious.
The kung fu manual yellowed with age still contained lethal techniques.
The yellowing of old books gives them a vintage charm.
To prevent yellowing, store your sneakers away from sunlight.
The yellowing of teeth can be caused by coffee or tea.
Her white dress showed signs of yellowing after improper washing.
Using acid-free paper helps prevent yellowing of important documents.
This special solution claims to reverse yellowing of plastic items.

examples.sentence: The morning fog made the sunlight appear yellowish over the Forbidden City.
Her yellowish qipao blended perfectly with the autumn leaves.
The old book pages had turned yellowish after decades.
The dentist showed me my slightly yellowish teeth under blue light.
The sunset painted the sky in yellowy hues over the West Lake.
Her yellowy umbrella stood out in the gray rainy street.
The old book pages had turned yellowy with age.
He served rice with yellowy curry that smelled of turmeric.
The sudden yelp from the alley scared the delivery guy.
Her yelp of surprise went viral on Douyin.
The corgi's angry yelps sounded like a squeaky toy.
Hearing the fox's yelps at night is common in rural areas.
She yelped when stubbing her toe on the mahjong table.
Tourists yelp with joy when seeing pandas roll.
Stop yelping orders like a drill sergeant!
He yelped the winning numbers through the megaphone.
The streamer let out a yelp when getting a superchat.

examples.sentence: A Yemeni shared his secret recipe for lamb mandi with me.
Yemenis are known for their intricate silver jewelry craftsmanship.
Yemeni coffee beans are considered the ancestors of mocha.
The Yemeni dialect has unique Arabic pronunciations.
Yemeni hospitality often involves serving guests with honey-drenched pastries.
Traditional Yemeni wedding celebrations can last for 21 days.
A bowl of authentic ramen costs about 1000 yen in Tokyo.
The anime figure I bought drained my last 5000 yen.
After watching Food Wars, I had a sudden yen for Japanese curry.
His yen for vintage game consoles fills his whole apartment.
Every otaku yens to visit Akihabara at least once.
She yens to collect all limited edition lipsticks from Shiseido.
Tourists always have a yen for authentic matcha desserts in Kyoto.
The yeomen of Nottingham famously opposed the Sheriff's taxes.
Chaucer's Canterbury Tales vividly depicts medieval yeomen with their longbows.
A yeoman farmer in 18th-century England typically owned 30-120 acres.
Thomas Jefferson idealized the yeoman as the backbone of democracy.
The old librarian has done yeoman's service in preserving rare manuscripts.
"Did you eat the last dumpling?" "Yep, and I'd do it again!"
"Is TikTok banned there?" "Yep, but we have Douyin!"
"Want spicy hotpot?" "Yep yep! Extra chili please!"

examples.sentence: Where's yer umbrella, mate? It's pouring outside!
Yer tea's getting cold, love.

examples.sentence: "Do you want bubble tea?" "Yes, with extra pearls!"
When the teacher asked if anyone liked spicy hotpot, 40 heads nodded yes.
Her eyes sparkled with a definite yes when seeing the Peking duck.
The final count was 15 yeses and 1 no (from the guy who hates cilantro).
He yesed enthusiastically when his boss mentioned free afternoon naps.
I'll never say yes to durian pizza!
Yesterday's hotpot leftovers became today's instant noodles topping.
The weather forecast said yesterday would be sunny, but it rained cats and dogs.
I binge-watched 30 episodes of a drama yesterday and now my eyes feel like burning.
She promised yesterday to help me with my homework, but forgot it completely today.
The day before yesterday was my cheat day, so today I'm back to eating salads.

examples.sentence: The hottest memes of yesteryear are now considered ancient history.
Her yesteryear's New Year resolution was to quit bingewatching.
Smartphones from yesteryear looked like bricks with antennas.
In yesteryear, people queued for hours to buy train tickets.
Yesteryear we still used MP3 players instead of streaming music.
This street was farmland yesteryear.
In the days of yesteryear, couples wrote love letters instead of texting.
The new iPhone model hasn't gone on sale yet.
Are you done with your homework yet?
Has your WeChat Pay balance reached 5 digits yet?
Is the bubble tea shop open yet?
After 20 years, he yet remembers his first bicycle.
The ancient city wall yet stands in the modern metropolis.
It's a simple app, yet extremely user-friendly.
She failed the test, yet she's still smiling.
The dish looks ordinary, yet it tastes amazing.
He's young, yet he speaks like a veteran.
As yet, no one has solved this math puzzle.
The metro line to your company is not open yet.

examples.sentence: Some Himalayan sherpas claim to have seen yeti footprints larger than pandas.
The yeti in the cartoon was actually a giant white rabbit.
That yeti sighting video turned out to be a man in a white gorilla suit.

examples.sentence: The yew in our campus is said to be 300 years old.
Ancient bows were often made from yew wood.
The churchyard yew tree witnessed countless weddings.
Kafka's family spoke Yiddish at home though wrote in German.
'Mazel tov!' is a Yiddish phrase now used worldwide.
The Yiddish theater in Warsaw attracts global scholars.
This Yiddish dictionary contains medieval merchant slang.
His Yiddish humor saved the tense negotiation.
That deli serves authentic Yiddish pickles.
'Schmooze' is a Yiddishism adopted by English.

examples.sentence: The rice yield in Hunan increased by 15% this year.
Tesla's battery yield determines its delivery speed.
The annual yield of this fund beats 90% competitors.
Real estate yields in first-tier cities are shrinking.
This vineyard yields the best Cabernet in Ningxia.
The new algorithm yields 20% more accurate results.
Yield your seat to pregnant women on subway.
The CEO yielded control to his successor.
The interrogator finally yielded the suspect.
No hardship could yield this mountaineer.
This land yields abundantly under organic farming.
The oil well no longer yields economically.
The rebel army yielded after 72 hours.
Never yield to unreasonable demands.
The car yielded to pedestrians at zebra crossing.
High-yield bonds carry greater risks.
The yin-yang symbol on my teapot reminds me to balance work and life.
Mooncakes with yin energy are said to cool the body in TCM.
Oracle bones from the Yin dynasty are priceless historical treasures.
The Yin Ruins museum displays magnificent bronze vessels.
"I'll have yin more whisky," said the kilt-wearing man at the pub.
The Scottish granny counted "yin, twa, three" with her grandchildren.
Tai Chi embodies the harmony of yin and yang energies.

examples.sentence: Yippee! My douyin video got 1 million likes!
Yippee! The hotpot buffet is half price today!
He shouted 'Yippee ki-yay' before riding the mechanical bull.
